output: Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827) was a German composer and pianist, a crucial figure in the transition between the Classical and Romantic eras in Western music. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest composers of all time. Despite losing his hearing in his late 20s, Beethoven composed some of his most important works, including nine symphonies, five piano concertos, 32 piano sonatas, and numerous chamber pieces and vocal music. His compositions are known for their emotional depth, innovative structures, and profound impact on the development of music.

instruction: What is formula one? Why is it so popular?
output: Formula One (F1) is the highest class of international single-seater auto racing, governed by the Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile (FIA). It features the fastest road course racing cars in the world, known for their cutting-edge technology and engineering. F1 is popular due to its thrilling high-speed races, global reach, iconic circuits, celebrity drivers, and intense team rivalries. The sport combines advanced engineering, strategy, and driving skill, captivating fans with its excitement and prestige.
